segment.source: Access this computer from the network (Windows 10)
segment.target: Access this computer from the network (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Access this computer from the network security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Access this computer from the network security policy setting.

segment.source: Access this computer from the network
segment.target: Access this computer from the network

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Access this computer from the network security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Access this computer from the network security policy setting.

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: The Access this computer from the network policy setting determines which users can connect to the device from the network.
segment.target: The Access this computer from the network policy setting determines which users can connect to the device from the network.

segment.source: This capability is required by a number of network protocols, including Server Message Block (SMB)-based protocols, NetBIOS, Common Internet File System (CIFS), and Component Object Model Plus (COM+).
segment.target: This capability is required by a number of network protocols, including Server Message Block (SMB)-based protocols, NetBIOS, Common Internet File System (CIFS), and Component Object Model Plus (COM+).

segment.source: Users, devices, and service accounts gain or lose the Access this computer from network user right by being explicitly or implicitly added or removed from a security group that has been granted this user right.
segment.target: Users, devices, and service accounts gain or lose the Access this computer from network user right by being explicitly or implicitly added or removed from a security group that has been granted this user right.

segment.source: For example, a user account or a machine account may be explicitly added to a custom security group or a built-in security group, or it may be implicitly added by Windows to a computed security group such as Domain Users, Authenticated Users, or Enterprise Domain Controllers.
segment.target: For example, a user account or a machine account may be explicitly added to a custom security group or a built-in security group, or it may be implicitly added by Windows to a computed security group such as Domain Users, Authenticated Users, or Enterprise Domain Controllers.

segment.source: By default, user accounts and machine accounts are granted the Access this computer from network user right when computed groups such as Authenticated Users, and for domain controllers, the Enterprise Domain Controllers group, are defined in the default domain controllers Group Policy Object (GPO).
segment.target: By default, user accounts and machine accounts are granted the Access this computer from network user right when computed groups such as Authenticated Users, and for domain controllers, the Enterprise Domain Controllers group, are defined in the default domain controllers Group Policy Object (GPO).

segment.source: Constant: SeNetworkLogonRight
segment.target: Constant: SeNetworkLogonRight

segment.source: Possible values
segment.target: Possible values

segment.source: User-defined list of accounts
segment.target: User-defined list of accounts

segment.source: Not defined
segment.target: Not defined

segment.source: Best practices
segment.target: Best practices

segment.source: On desktop devices or member servers, grant this right only to users and administrators.
segment.target: On desktop devices or member servers, grant this right only to users and administrators.

segment.source: On domain controllers, grant this right only to authenticated users, enterprise domain controllers, and administrators.
segment.target: On domain controllers, grant this right only to authenticated users, enterprise domain controllers, and administrators.

segment.source: This setting includes the Everyone group to ensure backward compatibility.
segment.target: This setting includes the Everyone group to ensure backward compatibility.

segment.source: Upon Windows upgrade, after you have verified that all users and groups are correctly migrated, you should remove the Everyone group and use the Authenticated Users group instead.
segment.target: Upon Windows upgrade, after you have verified that all users and groups are correctly migrated, you should remove the Everyone group and use the Authenticated Users group instead.

segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: Policy management
segment.target: Policy management

segment.source: When modifying this user right, the following actions might cause users and services to experience network access issues:
segment.target: When modifying this user right, the following actions might cause users and services to experience network access issues:

segment.source: Removing the Enterprise Domain Controllers security group
segment.target: Removing the Enterprise Domain Controllers security group

segment.source: Removing the Authenticated Users group or an explicit group that allows users, computers, and service accounts the user right to connect to computers over the network
segment.target: Removing the Authenticated Users group or an explicit group that allows users, computers, and service accounts the user right to connect to computers over the network

segment.source: Removing all user and machine accounts
segment.target: Removing all user and machine accounts

segment.source: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: Group Policy
segment.target: Group Policy

segment.source: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:
segment.target: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:

segment.target: Local policy settings

segment.target: Domain policy settings

segment.target: OU policy settings

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: Security considerations
segment.target: Security considerations

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Vulnerability
segment.target: Vulnerability

segment.source: Users who can connect from their device to the network can access resources on target devices for which they have permission.
segment.target: Users who can connect from their device to the network can access resources on target devices for which they have permission.

segment.source: For example, the Access this computer from the network user right is required for users to connect to shared printers and folders.
segment.target: For example, the Access this computer from the network user right is required for users to connect to shared printers and folders.

segment.source: If this user right is assigned to the Everyone group, anyone in the group can read the files in those shared folders.
segment.target: If this user right is assigned to the Everyone group, anyone in the group can read the files in those shared folders.

segment.source: This situation is unlikely because the groups created by a default installation of at least Windows Server 2008 R2 or Windows 7 do not include the Everyone group.
segment.target: This situation is unlikely because the groups created by a default installation of at least Windows Server 2008 R2 or Windows 7 do not include the Everyone group.

segment.source: However, if a device is upgraded and the original device includes the Everyone group as part of its defined users and groups, that group is transitioned as part of the upgrade process and is present on the device.
segment.target: However, if a device is upgraded and the original device includes the Everyone group as part of its defined users and groups, that group is transitioned as part of the upgrade process and is present on the device.

segment.source: Countermeasure
segment.target: Countermeasure

segment.source: Restrict the Access this computer from the network user right to only those users and groups who require access to the computer.
segment.target: Restrict the Access this computer from the network user right to only those users and groups who require access to the computer.

segment.source: For example, if you configure this policy setting to the Administrators and Users groups, users who log on to the domain can access resources that are shared from servers in the domain if members of the Domain Users group are included in the local Users group.
segment.target: For example, if you configure this policy setting to the Administrators and Users groups, users who log on to the domain can access resources that are shared from servers in the domain if members of the Domain Users group are included in the local Users group.

segment.source: Note If you are using IPsec to help secure network communications in your organization, ensure that a group that includes machine accounts is given this right.
segment.target: Note If you are using IPsec to help secure network communications in your organization, ensure that a group that includes machine accounts is given this right.

segment.source: This right is required for successful computer authentication.
segment.target: This right is required for successful computer authentication.

segment.source: Assigning this right to Authenticated Users or Domain Computers meets this requirement.
segment.target: Assigning this right to Authenticated Users or Domain Computers meets this requirement.

segment.source: Potential impact
segment.target: Potential impact

segment.source: If you remove the Access this computer from the network user right on domain controllers for all users, no one can log on to the domain or use network resources.
segment.target: If you remove the Access this computer from the network user right on domain controllers for all users, no one can log on to the domain or use network resources.

segment.source: If you remove this user right on member servers, users cannot connect to those servers through the network.
segment.target: If you remove this user right on member servers, users cannot connect to those servers through the network.

segment.source: If you have installed optional components such as ASP.NET or Internet Information Services (IIS), you may need to assign this user right to additional accounts that are required by those components.
segment.target: If you have installed optional components such as ASP.NET or Internet Information Services (IIS), you may need to assign this user right to additional accounts that are required by those components.

segment.source: It is important to verify that authorized users are assigned this user right for the devices that they need to access the network.
segment.target: It is important to verify that authorized users are assigned this user right for the devices that they need to access the network.
